item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "You didn't kill him. He would have killed you, but you didn't kill him." "So? He was stupid. If I killed everyone who was stupid, I wouldn't have time to sleep." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "Curiosity killed the cat,” Fesgao remarked, his dark eyes unreadable. Aly rolled her eyes. Why did everyone say that to her? “People always forget the rest of the saying,” she complained. “‘And satisfaction brought it back." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "If you've a story, make sure it's a whole one, with details close to hand. It's the difference between a good lie and getting caught." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "Lord Raoul asked me to tell you that if you get yourself killed, he will never speak to you again." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce (Page)
Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "I think it's fair rude to make him a tree and not know what kind he is." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "When people say a knight's job is all glory, I laugh and laugh and laugh. Often I can stop laughing before they edge away and talk about soothing drinks." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "I distrust any advice that contains the words 'ought' or 'should'." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "A good friend will help you up when you fall. A best friend will laugh and try to trip you again. - I'm not sure" -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "But, Sergeant Osbern, Sir, I like my head." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "I'd like to find whoever taught the Stump that extra work builds character and push him down the stairs," Neal told Kel at lunch." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "You must tell Lady Alanna that sometime. I'd do it from a distance." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "Military folk," Neal said with exaggerated patience, shaking his head. "The only way you know to solve problems is by beating them with a stick." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "Does anyone in this land act like they're supposed to?" -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "I'm about to commence four years of obeying the cause of a bruiser on a horse. I refuse to put down what might be the last book I see for months." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "Why do I get the feeling that if you give me a hard time, I'll tell all of our year-mates your family nickname is Meathead?" -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "When in doubt, shoot the wizard." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "I swear the sparrows called us ten kinds of idiot when we did it." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "I love you, if you get yourself killed, I will never forgive you." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by George via Tamora Pierce
item.description: "There are plenty of fish in the sea besides Prince Jonathan, and this particular fish loves you with all his crooked heart." -- George via Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "I will tell the stork-man." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "It is possible to be in love with you just because of who you are." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "What do you eat?" "Baby bunnies." She narrowed her eyes, so I grinned and said, "Adult bunnies, too. I'm an equal-opportunity bunny-eater." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "So, Grace, how's school?" I asked myself. Dad nodded, eyes on the baby koala now struggling in the guest's arms. "Oh, it's fine," I continued, and Dad made a mumbling noise of agreement. I added, "Nothing special, aside from the load of pandas they brought in, and the teachers abandoning us to cannibalistic savages-" I paused to see if I'd caught his attention yet, then pressed on. "The whole building caught fire, then I failed drama, and then sex, sex, sex." Dad's eyes abruptly focused, and he turned to me and frowned. "What did you say they were teaching you in school?" -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "You two are too cute,” the counter girl said, setting two cups piled with whipped cream on the counter. She had a sort of lopsided, open smile that made me think she laughed a lot. “Seriously. How long have you been going out?” Sam let go of my hands to get his wallet and took out some bills. “Six years.” I wrinkled my nose to cover a laugh. Of course he would count the time that we’d been two entirely different species. Whoa.” Counter girl nodded appreciatively. “That’s pretty amazing for a couple your age." Sam handed me my hot chocolate and didn’t answer. But his yellow eyes gazed at me possessively—I wondered if he realized that the way he looked at me was far more intimate than copping a feel could ever be. I crouched to look at the almond bark on the bottom shelf in the counter. I wasn’t quite bold enough to look at either of them when I admitted, “Well, it was love at first sight.” The girl sighed. “That is just so romantic. Do me a favor, and don’t you two ever change. The world needs more love at first sight." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "As the hours crept by, the afternoon sunlight bleached all the books on the shelves to pale, gilded versions of themselves and warmed the paper and ink inside the covers so that the smell of unread words hung in the air." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "Lunch." I said. "Immediately. I'm going to wither away to absolutely nothing. Then you'll be racked with guilt." "I doubt it." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "He slouched back in his seat, looking tired, and leaned his face on his shoulder to look at me while he played with my hair. He started to hum a song, and then, after a few bars, he sang it. Quietly, sort of half-sung, half-spoken, incredibly gentle. I didn’t catch all the words, but it was about his summer girl. Me. Maybe his forever girl. His yellow eyes were half-lidded as he sang, and in that golden moment, hanging taut in the middle of an icecovered landscape like a single bubble of summer nectar, I could see how my life could be stretched out in front of me." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "Some days seem to fit together like a stained glass window. A hundred little pieces of different color and mood that, when combined, create a complete picture." -- Maggie Stiefvater
